```{r, user_configuration}
#### USER CONFIGURATION #####

# set the directory to where the metadata file is on your machine
metadata_path <- "/my_project/smncrna_analysis_template/metadata.csv
```

```{r, setup_2}
# activate renv
renv::activate()

# load libraries
library(plyr)
library(dplyr)
library(plotly)
library(gtools)
library(BiocManager)
library(limma)
library(textshape)
library(DT)
library(yaml)

# read in yaml config file specifying which rna species to analyse
config <- yaml.load_file("../rna_species_config.yaml")

# create a dataframe definning the rna species to analyse (that are set to TRUE) based on the yaml user configuration file
to_analyse <- config %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  t() %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  tibble::rownames_to_column("rna_species") %>%
  dplyr::rename("analyse" = "V1") %>%
  filter(analyse == TRUE)

# also create a list for downstream filtering
to_analyse_list <- to_analyse %>%
  pull(rna_species) %>%
  as.list()

# read in pre-prepared count data
counts <- utils::read.csv("../prepare_counts/counts.csv")

# read in metadata
metadata <- utils::read.csv(metadata_path)

# join with metadata
counts <- dplyr::left_join(counts, metadata, by = "sample")
```

```{bash}
# create a directory to write data to file (if it doesn't yet exist)
mkdir -p mds_results/mds/
```

```{r, eval = config$all_rnas, results = "asis"}
# pretty format the text for the header
to_analyse_pretty <- to_analyse %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
    mutate(rna_species = replace(rna_species, rna_species == "mirna", "miRNA's")) %>%
    mutate(rna_species = replace(rna_species, rna_species == "pirna", "piRNA's")) %>%
    mutate(rna_species = replace(rna_species, rna_species == "trna", "tRNA's")) %>%
    mutate(rna_species = replace(rna_species, rna_species == "gencode", "gencode's"))

# create a character string (from the list) of the rna species being analysed to put into the header
to_analyse_pretty <- to_analyse_pretty %>%
  pull(rna_species) %>%
  as.list()

to_analyse_pretty <- paste0(to_analyse_pretty, collapse = " ")

# dynamically build up a header based on the rna species being analysed
cat(paste0("## All RNA's analysed: ", to_analyse_pretty, " ", "{.tabset .tabset-fade}"))
```

```{r, eval = config$all_rnas, out.width = "100%"}
# calculate MDS
mds <- counts %>%
  dplyr::filter(pipeline == "excerpt") %>%
  # analyse/plot only the rna species the user has specified to analyse
  dplyr::filter(rna_species %in% to_analyse_list) %>%
  dplyr::select(sample, rna, counts_per_million) %>%
  tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = sample, values_from = counts_per_million) %>%
  textshape::column_to_rownames("rna") %>%
  base::as.matrix() %>%
  limma::plotMDS(plot = FALSE)

# extract data and make into a dataframe for plotting
data <-base:: cbind(mds$x, mds$y) %>%
  base::as.data.frame() %>%
  plyr::rename(c("V1" = "dim1")) %>%
  plyr::rename(c("V2" = "dim2")) %>%
  tibble::rownames_to_column("sample")

# save data to file
write.csv(data, "mds_results/mds/mds_excerpt_all_rnas.csv", row.names = FALSE)

# bind data with metadata to get the treatment column
data <- left_join(data, metadata, by = "sample")

# plot!
data %>%
  plot_ly(mode = "markers",
          x = ~dim1,
          y = ~dim2,
          color = ~treatment,
          hoverinfo = "text",
          text = ~paste("</br> Sample:", sample,
                        "</br> Dim1:", format(dim1, big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE, digits = 2),
                        "</br> Dim2:", format(dim2, big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE, digits = 2))) %>%
  layout(xaxis = list(title = "Dim1"),
         yaxis = list(title = "Dim2"))
```

```{r, eval = config$all_rnas, out.width = "100%"}
# plot data in datatable
DT::datatable(data %>%
                dplyr::select(sample,
                              treatment,
                              dim1,
                              dim2),
              filter = "top",
              rownames = FALSE,
              colnames = c("Sample",
                           "Treatment",
                           "dim1",
                           "dim2"),
              extensions = list("ColReorder" = NULL,
                                "Buttons" = NULL,
                                "FixedColumns" = list(leftColumns=1)),
              options = list(
                dom = "BRrltpi",
                autoWidth = TRUE,
                columnDefs = list(list(width = "200px", targets = 0)),
                lengthMenu = list(c(10, 50, -1), c("10", "50", "All")),
                ColReorder = TRUE,
                buttons =
                  list("copy",
                       list(extend = "collection",
                            buttons = c("csv", "excel", "pdf"),
                            text = "Download"),
                       I("colvis"))))
```
